info.description: Expose REST API for the datarhei Core
info.title: datarhei Core API

get.description: API version and build infos in case auth is valid or not required. If auth is required, just the name field is populated.
Load GraphQL playground

post.description: Retrieve valid JWT access and refresh tokens to use for accessing the API. Login either by username/password or Auth0 token
post.summary: Retrieve an access and a refresh token

get.description: Retrieve a new access token by providing the refresh token
Swagger UI for this API
Retrieve the currently active Restreamer configuration
get.summary: Retrieve the currently active Restreamer configuration

put.description: Update the current Restreamer configuration by providing a complete or partial configuration. Fields that are not provided will not be changed.

get.description: Reload the currently active configuration. This will trigger a restart of the Restreamer.
List all files on the filesystem. The listing can be ordered by name, size, or date of last modification in ascending or descending order.
get.summary: List all files on the filesystem

get.description: Fetch a file from the filesystem. The contents of that file are returned.
get.summary: Fetch a file from the filesystem

put.description: Writes or overwrites a file on the filesystem
put.summary: Add a file to the filesystem

delete.description: Remove a file from the filesystem
delete.summary: Remove a file from the filesystem

get.description: List all files on the memory filesystem. The listing can be ordered by name, size, or date of last modification in ascending or descending order.
get.summary: List all files on the memory filesystem

get.description: Fetch a file from the memory filesystem
get.summary: Fetch a file from the memory filesystem

put.description: Writes or overwrites a file on the memory filesystem
put.summary: Add a file to the memory filesystem

delete.description: Remove a file from the memory filesystem
delete.summary: Remove a file from the memory filesystem

patch.description: Create a link to a file in the memory filesystem. The file linked to has to exist.
patch.summary: Create a link to a file in the memory filesystem

parameters.description: Path to the file to link to
parameters.name: url

get.description: Get the last log lines of the Restreamer application

parameters.description: Format of the list of log events (*console, raw)
parameters.name: format

get.description: Retrieve the previously stored JSON metadata under the given key. If the key is empty, all metadata will be returned.
get.summary: Retrieve JSON metadata from a key

put.description: Add arbitrary JSON metadata under the given key. If the key exists, all already stored metadata with this key will be overwritten. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created.
put.summary: Add JSON metadata under the given key

get.description: List all known processes. Use the query parameter to filter the listed processes.

parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields (config, state, report, metadata) that will be part of the output. If empty, all fields will be part of the output
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Return only these process that have this reference value. Overrides a list of IDs. If empty, the reference will be ignored
parameters.name: reference

parameters.description: Comma separated list of process ids to list
parameters.name: id

get.description: List a process by its ID. Use the filter parameter to specifiy the level of detail of the output.
get.summary: List a process by its ID

parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields (config, state, report, metadata) to be part of the output. If empty, all fields will be part of the output
parameters.name: filter

put.description: Replace an existing process. This is a shortcut for DELETE+POST.

delete.description: Delete a process by its ID
delete.summary: Delete a process by its ID

put.description: Issue a command to a process: start, stop, reload, restart
put.summary: Issue a command to a process

get.description: Get the configuration of a process. This is the configuration as provided by Add or Update.
get.summary: Get the configuration of a process

get.description: Retrieve the previously stored JSON metadata under the given key. If the key is empty, all metadata will be returned.
get.summary: Retrieve JSON metadata stored with a process under a key

put.description: Add arbitrary JSON metadata under the given key. If the key exists, all already stored metadata with this key will be overwritten. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created.
put.summary: Add JSON metadata with a process under the given key

parameters.description: Arbitrary JSON data. The null value will remove the key and its contents
parameters.name: data

get.description: Immediately encode the errorframe (if available and looping)

post.description: Upload an error frame which will be encoded immediately

parameters.description: Any filename with a suitable extension
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Image to be used a error frame
parameters.name: image

get.description: Get the last keyframe of an input of a process. The extension of the name determines the return type.

parameters.description: Any filename with an extension of .jpg or .png
parameters.name: name

get.description: Close the current input stream such that it will be automatically re-opened
Get the current playout status of an input of a process

put.description: Replace the current stream with the one from the given URL. The switch will only happen if the stream parameters match.

get.description: Probe an existing process to get a detailed stream information on the inputs
Get the logs and the log history of a process
get.summary: Get the logs of a process

get.description: Get the state and progress data of a process
get.summary: Get the state of a process

get.description: List all currently publishing RTMP streams
Get a summary of all active and past sessions of the given collector
get.summary: Get a summary of all active and past sessions

get.description: Get a minimal summary of all active sessions (i.e. number of sessions, bandwidth)
get.summary: Get a minimal summary of all active sessions

get.description: List all detected FFmpeg capabilities
Refresh the available FFmpeg capabilities
List all currently publishing SRT streams. This endpoint is EXPERIMENTAL and may change in future.
Fetch minimal statistics about a process, which is not protected by any auth.
get.summary: Fetch minimal statistics about a process

get.description: Fetch a file from the memory filesystem
get.summary: Fetch a file from the memory filesystem

put.description: Writes or overwrites a file on the memory filesystem
put.summary: Add a file to the memory filesystem

delete.description: Remove a file from the memory filesystem
delete.summary: Remove a file from the memory filesystem

get.description: Prometheus metrics
Liveliness check
Retrieve profiling data from the application
get.summary: Retrieve profiling data from the application

get.description: Fetch a file from the filesystem. If the file is a directory, a index.html is returned, if it exists.
get.summary: Fetch a file from the filesystem

avail_recv_buf_bytes.description: The available space in the receiver's buffer, in bytes

avail_send_buf_bytes.description: The available space in the sender's buffer, in bytes

bandwidth_mbit.description: Estimated bandwidth of the network link, in Mbps

flight_size_pkt.description: The number of packets in flight

flow_window_pkt.description: The maximum number of packets that can be "in flight"

pkt_recv_avg_belated_time_ms.description: Accumulated difference between the current time and the time-to-play of a packet that is received late

pkt_send_period_us.description: Current minimum time interval between which consecutive packets are sent, in microseconds

recv_ack_pkt.description: The total number of received ACK (Acknowledgement) control packets

recv_buf_bytes.description: Instantaneous (current) value of pktRcvBuf, expressed in bytes, including payload and all headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

recv_buf_ms.description: The timespan (msec) of acknowledged packets in the receiver's buffer

recv_buf_pkt.description: The number of acknowledged packets in receiver's buffer

recv_bytes.description: Same as pktRecv, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

recv_drop_bytes.description: Same as pktRcvDrop, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

recv_drop_pkt.description: The total number of dropped by the SRT receiver and, as a result, not delivered to the upstream application DATA packets

recv_km_pkt.description: The total number of received KM (Key Material) control packets

recv_loss__bytes.description: Same as pktRcvLoss, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT), bytes for the presently missing (either reordered or lost) packets' payloads are estimated based on the average packet size

recv_loss_pkt.description: The total number of SRT DATA packets detected as presently missing (either reordered or lost) at the receiver side

recv_nak_pkt.description: The total number of received NAK (Negative Acknowledgement) control packets

recv_pkt.description: The total number of received DATA packets, including retransmitted packets

recv_retran_pkts.description: The total number of retransmitted packets registered at the receiver side

recv_tsbpd_delay_ms.description: Timestamp-based Packet Delivery Delay value set on the socket via SRTO_RCVLATENCY or SRTO_LATENCY

recv_undecrypt_bytes.description: Same as pktRcvUndecrypt, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

recv_undecrypt_pkt.description: The total number of packets that failed to be decrypted at the receiver side

recv_unique_bytes.description: Same as pktRecvUnique, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

recv_unique_pkt.description: The total number of unique original, retransmitted or recovered by the packet filter DATA packets received in time, decrypted without errors and, as a result, scheduled for delivery to the upstream application by the SRT receiver.

reorder_tolerance_pkt.description: Instant value of the packet reorder tolerance

rtt_ms.description: Smoothed round-trip time (SRTT), an exponentially-weighted moving average (EWMA) of an endpoint's RTT samples, in milliseconds

send_buf_bytes.description: Instantaneous (current) value of pktSndBuf, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

send_buf_ms.description: The timespan (msec) of packets in the sender's buffer (unacknowledged packets)

send_buf_pkt.description: The number of packets in the sender's buffer that are already scheduled for sending or even possibly sent, but not yet acknowledged

send_drop_bytes.description: Same as pktSndDrop, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

send_drop_pkt.description: The total number of dropped by the SRT sender DATA packets that have no chance to be delivered in time

send_duration_us.description: The total accumulated time in microseconds, during which the SRT sender has some data to transmit, including packets that have been sent, but not yet acknowledged

send_km_pkt.description: The total number of sent KM (Key Material) control packets

send_loss_pkt.description: The total number of data packets considered or reported as lost at the sender side. Does not correspond to the packets detected as lost at the receiver side.

send_tsbpd_delay_ms.description: Timestamp-based Packet Delivery Delay value of the peer

sent_ack_pkt.description: The total number of sent ACK (Acknowledgement) control packets

sent_bytes.description: Same as pktSent, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

sent_nak_pkt.description: The total number of sent NAK (Negative Acknowledgement) control packets

sent_pkt.description: The total number of sent DATA packets, including retransmitted packets

sent_retrans_bytes.description: Same as pktRetrans, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

sent_retrans_pkt.description: The total number of retransmitted packets sent by the SRT sender

sent_unique__bytes.description: Same as pktSentUnique, but expressed in bytes, including payload and all the headers (IP, TCP, SRT)

sent_unique_pkt.description: The total number of unique DATA packets sent by the SRT sender

timestamp_ms.description: The time elapsed, in milliseconds, since the SRT socket has been created
